Hello there!

I just wanted to give a short update on the situation of the 502 errors. As commented back when the 0.24 release was still a few days away the 502 errors are caused by the forum's server being overloaded with work. It cannot handle the amount of traffic the forums are generating and the huge database that it maintains of all your lovely contributions. There are a few solutions to this problem: you can upgrade the server, separate the front-end and database into two different servers, change forum software and so on. Squad is currently looking into different options, but most likely is that the current server will be upgraded. Rest assured that they are aware of the problem and that it's being worked on.

Hopefully, it wouldn't cause the April 2013 incident. A good number of members were lost that day, and I'm not sure if we've completely recovered or not. Whatever the case, there's a huge hole in the forum records from 0.17-0.20.

Ever since that happened the server has been making daily backups. The 502 errors just indicate that the server has no time for your request and not that it's losing data. But even in case things do go horribly horribly wrong we have that daily backup
Thanks Kasper, appreciate the heads up
